paragraphs.content: Psalm 74
paragraphs.contentHtml: Psalm 74

paragraphs.content: Maschil of Asaph.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Maschil of Asaph.

paragraphs.content: O God, why hast thou cast us off for ever? why doth thine anger smoke against the sheep of thy pasture?
paragraphs.contentHtml: O God, why hast thou cast us off for ever? why doth thine anger smoke against the sheep of thy pasture?

paragraphs.content: Remember thy congregation, which thou hast purchased of old; the rod of thine inheritance, which thou hast redeemed; this mount Zion, wherein thou hast dwelt.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Remember thy congregation, which thou hast purchased of old; the rod of thine inheritance, which thou hast redeemed; this mount Zion, wherein thou hast dwelt.

paragraphs.content: Lift up thy feet unto the perpetual desolations; even all that the enemy hath done wickedly in the sanctuary.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Lift up thy feet unto the perpetual desolations; even all that the enemy hath done wickedly in the sanctuary.

paragraphs.content: Thine enemies roar in the midst of thy congregations; they set up their ensigns for signs.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thine enemies roar in the midst of thy congregations; they set up their ensigns for signs.

paragraphs.content: A man was famous according as he had lifted up axes upon the thick trees.
paragraphs.contentHtml: A man was famous according as he had lifted up axes upon the thick trees.

paragraphs.content: But now they break down the carved work thereof at once with axes and hammers.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But now they break down the carved work thereof at once with axes and hammers.

paragraphs.content: They have cast fire into thy sanctuary, they have defiled by casting down the dwelling place of thy name to the ground.
paragraphs.contentHtml: They have cast fire into thy sanctuary, they have defiled by casting down the dwelling place of thy name to the ground.

paragraphs.content: They said in their hearts, Let us destroy them together: they have burned up all the synagogues of God in the land.
paragraphs.contentHtml: They said in their hearts, Let us destroy them together: they have burned up all the synagogues of God in the land.

paragraphs.content: We see not our signs: there is no more any prophet: neither is there among us any that knoweth how long.
paragraphs.contentHtml: We see not our signs: there is no more any prophet: neither is there among us any that knoweth how long.

paragraphs.content: O God, how long shall the adversary reproach? shall the enemy blaspheme thy name for ever?
paragraphs.contentHtml: O God, how long shall the adversary reproach? shall the enemy blaspheme thy name for ever?

paragraphs.content: Why withdrawest thou thy hand, even thy right hand? pluck it out of thy bosom.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Why withdrawest thou thy hand, even thy right hand? pluck it out of thy bosom.

paragraphs.content: For God is my King of old, working salvation in the midst of the earth.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For God is my King of old, working salvation in the midst of the earth.

paragraphs.content: Thou didst divide the sea by thy strength: thou brakest the heads of the dragons in the waters.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thou didst divide the sea by thy strength: thou brakest the heads of the dragons in the waters.

paragraphs.content: Thou brakest the heads of leviathan in pieces, and gavest him to be meat to the people inhabiting the wilderness.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thou brakest the heads of leviathan in pieces, and gavest him to be meat to the people inhabiting the wilderness.

paragraphs.content: Thou didst cleave the fountain and the flood: thou driedst up mighty rivers.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thou didst cleave the fountain and the flood: thou driedst up mighty rivers.

paragraphs.content: The day is thine, the night also is thine: thou hast prepared the light and the sun.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The day is thine, the night also is thine: thou hast prepared the light and the sun.

paragraphs.content: Thou hast set all the borders of the earth: thou hast made summer and winter.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thou hast set all the borders of the earth: thou hast made summer and winter.

paragraphs.content: Remember this, that the enemy hath reproached, O LORD, and that the foolish people have blasphemed thy name.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Remember this, that the enemy hath reproached, O Lord, and that the foolish people have blasphemed thy name.

paragraphs.content: O deliver not the soul of thy turtledove unto the multitude of the wicked: forget not the congregation of thy poor for ever.
paragraphs.contentHtml: O deliver not the soul of thy turtledove unto the multitude of the wicked: forget not the congregation of thy poor for ever.

paragraphs.content: Have respect unto the covenant: for the dark places of the earth are full of the habitations of cruelty.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Have respect unto the covenant: for the dark places of the earth are full of the habitations of cruelty.

paragraphs.content: O let not the oppressed return ashamed: let the poor and needy praise thy name.
paragraphs.contentHtml: O let not the oppressed return ashamed: let the poor and needy praise thy name.

paragraphs.content: Arise, O God, plead thine own cause: remember how the foolish man reproacheth thee daily.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Arise, O God, plead thine own cause: remember how the foolish man reproacheth thee daily.

paragraphs.content: Forget not the voice of thine enemies: the tumult of those that rise up against thee increaseth continually.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Forget not the voice of thine enemies: the tumult of those that rise up against thee increaseth continually.
